name: Floodplain water retention
functionStatement: Wetlands and storage features store floodwater, recharge groundwater, sustain baseflow, and provide low-velocity habitat.
descriptionMarkdown: Moderate floods (~1-5 yr) reach the floodplain, providing water retention/infiltration per regional norms.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Identify bankfull indicators and recent high-water marks and compare to bankfull elevation. Corroborate with a nearby gage bankfull or recurrence estimate where available.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Rarely or never overbanking below ~10-yr events. Incision or levees present
Criteria: Rarely or never overbanking below ~10-yr events. Incision or levees present

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Overbanking mainly at ~5-10 yr events. Partial disconnection
Criteria: Overbanking mainly at ~5-10 yr events. Partial disconnection

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Overbanking requires slightly larger than bankfull but not rare
Criteria: Overbanking requires slightly larger than bankfull but not rare

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Overbanking frequency based on field indicators and gage context
Criteria: Floodplain engages at ~1-2 yr or 2-5 yr events

references: USFS and NRCS bankfull field guides
